definition: to check attendance (at school or workplace)/to monitor efficiency (of workers)
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
diligent/industrious/hardworking/frequent/regular/constant
variant of 勤[qin2]/industrious/solicitous
attendance record book
attendance sheet

sentences.english: Don't forget to sign your overtime on our roll book .
sentences.chinese: 别忘了在公司考勤表上签上你的加班时间。

sentences.english: This is a record of school attendance.
sentences.chinese: 这是一份学生考勤记录。

sentences.english: Record the working attendance of Repair Department.
This is evaluated by the experimental results of the teacher's daily attendance records.
sentences.chinese: 该成绩根据实验指导老师每日的考勤记录进行评定。

sentences.english: Perfrom attendance checks and submit statistics reports.
sentences.chinese: 做好学习考勤和统计上报工作。

sentences.english: If you work in a factory, you usually have to punch a clock.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在工厂上班，通常得打考勤卡。

sentences.english: Aion timecard can offer you more game time.
sentences.chinese: 永恒之塔考勤卡可以为您提供更多的游戏时间。

sentences.english: Provided time record of one employee is missing specific time-in and time-out.
sentences.chinese: 一名员工的考勤记录缺少具体的上下班打卡时间。

sentences.english: This is a list of school presence.
sentences.chinese: 这是一份学生考勤记实。

sentences.english: Do you ever work when your timecard is not recorded?
sentences.chinese: 当你的考勤卡没记录的时候，你是否还在工作？

sentences.english: The other half choose attendance loose quiz exam courses.
sentences.chinese: 另一半选择考勤宽松，随堂考试的课程。

sentences.english: Responsible to oversee and enforce policies to insure faculty abides by stated policy.
sentences.chinese: 负责监督和执行考勤制度保证教职工遵守我们的制度。

sentences.english: And we pay only according to the hours written on the time sheep.
sentences.chinese: 我们只按考勤表上填写的时间付工资。

sentences.english: The attendance record is an important reference for salary calculation and performance evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 考勤记录是工资计算和绩效评估的一个重要参考。

sentences.english: Consolidate the Division's Monthly Attendance Sheet.

definition: attendance sheet
to be absent from work or school
to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to skip work/absence without leave
performance/results/achievement
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
rush hour
abbr. of 人力資源|人力资源[ren2 li4 zi1 yuan2]
leave of absence for a personal matter
guarded entrance
to work office hours/on duty
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
piece rate wage/remuneration based on one's output/opposite: time rate wage 計時工資|计时工资[ji4 shi2 gong1 zi1]
to report expenses/to submit accounts
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
